Looking at the differential table of http://hl7.org/fhir/us/cancer-reporting/2021Sep/StructureDefinition-us-pathology-diagnostic-report.html

image.png

... why does subject appear? From what I can tell, it looks no different from `subject in the base profile:

image.png

Am I missing something, or is this row being incorrectly included in the differential?
I would say it is being needlessly included, rather than incorrectly included
Well, fair enough -- I mean, the point of the "differential" view is to hide stuff that hasn't changed, right?
(If you agree this is worth fixing, I'm happy to file a bug in whatever's the right place. If not, that's OK!)
it just represents what the profile does. There's no logic to take things away from the profile just because it restates things that are already true.
And I don't think that there should be
Ah, so you're saying this profile needless re-states the definition, and the "differential" view faithfully renders that.
So that's a bug in the profile. I'll file that in my ballot comments.
Josh Mandel has marked this topic as resolved.

That IG an explicit definition of Must Support; I'm guessing their inclusion of an element without changes is to signify that you must conform to their Must Support for that element (in addition to the inherited flag from US Core Patient).

That's pretty subtle though - if we have inherited profiles, do we need some way to disambiguate between or consolidate the conformance rules of Must Support?

I'll note that the IG does contain a hint that anything not profiled by them should conform to the US Core Must Support definition. But, right now the only way I can see to actually tell the difference is to flip back and forth between the Differential and Snapshot comparing elements.

Wow, yeah -- this is the pain of having a single "Must-Support" flag and meaning different things by it. In the snapshot view, you can't tell if an element is "US Core Must-Support" or "Pathology Must-Support".

They might think they're doing that, but they're not. IGs inherit the mustSupport rules from their parent and any mustSupport rules they introduce in their IG apply to all elements, whether listed in their differential or not.
i.e. all US-core AND pathology must-support rules apply to all mustSupport elements in all profiles used by the IG.

any mustSupport rules they introduce in their IG apply to all elements, whether listed in their differential or not.

But Must-Support "Rules" are just text; the rules can be element-speific, if the text says "Our definition of MustSupport for Patient.name is ...; Our definition of MustSupport for Patient.birthdate is ..."
But in most cases only a few textual rules are stated for the elements/attributes. The idea is to collect them somewhere, arrange them (as a structure) and then add to SD as a MS extension....
were we to adopt something, the publisher would adopt it too
